meanings.definition: The state of being jittery or nervous.
meanings.sent1: Her jitteriness was evident as she tapped her foot anxiously.
meanings.sent2: The kitten's jitteriness was due to the loud thunder outside.
meanings.sent3: The jitteriness of the squirrel made it drop the nut it was holding.
meanings.sent4: The jitteriness in the air before the storm was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The jitteriness in her voice revealed her fear.

meanings.definition: The quality or characteristic of being jittery.
meanings.sent1: The jitteriness of the old floorboards made them creak with every step.
meanings.sent2: His jitteriness was noticeable in the way he constantly fidgeted with his pen.
meanings.sent3: The jitteriness of the puppy was endearing as it wagged its tail uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The jitteriness of the leaves in the wind created a soothing rustling sound.
meanings.sent5: The jitteriness of the alarm system made it prone to false alerts.

meanings.definition: A feeling of nervousness or unease.
meanings.sent1: The jitteriness in her stomach grew as she waited for the exam results.
meanings.sent2: His jitteriness before the presentation was evident in his shaky hands.
meanings.sent3: The jitteriness in the room disappeared once the lights were turned on.
meanings.sent4: The jitteriness in the crowd was calmed by the speaker's reassuring words.
meanings.sent5: The jitteriness in the air was dispelled by the calming presence of the mentor.
